clue: I help you mark the days and months with numbers neat and clear. What am I?

hints.text: I hang on walls or sit on desks
I show months, weeks, and days
People use me to plan appointments and events

clue: I am huge and gray with a long trunk to spare, roaming lands with a wrinkled stare. What am I?

hints.text: I’m one of the largest land animals
I have a long trunk and big ears
I’m known for my tusks and thick, wrinkled skin

clue: I carry your books and snacks upon my back, with straps to hold me snug and tight. What am I?

hints.text: Students wear me to school
I have straps to go over your shoulders
I hold notebooks, pencils, and lunch inside

clue: I hold blank pages that wait for words and art, a quiet place where ideas start. What am I?

hints.text: I open to reveal many pages
You write notes and draw inside me
Students use me to take class notes every day

clue: I stomp and roar in tales of old, with sharp teeth and a story bold. What am I?

hints.text: I lived long ago, not today
I come in many shapes — some had wings, some had long necks
You find my bones as fossils in museums

clue: I have two slices, fillings in between, a tasty bite that’s often seen. What am I?

hints.text: You might bring me for lunch
I usually have bread with things inside
People make me with cheese, ham, veggies, or peanut butter

clue: I hide shiny things and maps of gold, a secret place where stories are told. What am I?

hints.text: Pirates often search for me
I can be jewels, coins, or something very precious
Maps sometimes lead to my hidden chest

clue: I blaze and fly like a fiery ball across the sky or in a game’s call. What am I?

hints.text: I’m a ball with a bright, burning look
I may appear in stories, games, or magical scenes
Think of a glowing orb that shoots through the air

clue: I rise up high with peaks and snow, a giant place where cold winds blow. What am I?

hints.text: I’m taller than hills
People climb me for views and hikes
I have rocky slopes and sometimes snow at the top

clue: I have three sides and corners three, a simple shape as plain can be. What am I?

hints.text: I’m a basic shape in geometry
I have three straight edges and three points
A pyramid’s base can be this shape if seen from above

clue: I live inside a box and blink and hum, helping you work and play and have some fun. What am I?

hints.text: I can connect to the internet
You use me to type, play games, and browse
I might be a laptop or a desktop machine

clue: I fly through the air when swung just right, a round friend in a game of might. What am I?

hints.text: I’m used in a bat-and-ball sport
Players pitch, hit, and catch me
I’m white with red stitching

clue: I warm the day with golden light, lifting faces up and bright. What am I?

hints.text: I come from the sky on clear days
You feel me on your skin at the park
I’m sunlight that makes the world bright and warm

clue: I help heal and mend when people ache, a place of care for everyone’s sake. What am I?

hints.text: I’m a big building where doctors work
People come to me when they’re sick or hurt
I have nurses, doctors, and many patient rooms

clue: I join your arm to body near, helping lift and carry things you bear. What am I?

hints.text: I’m part of your body between arm and neck
You shrug me when you don’t know an answer
People carry bags on me and pat me for comfort

clue: I test your strength in long-turned ways, a race through miles that earns praise. What am I?

hints.text: I’m a long run, much longer than a sprint
Runners train for me for many weeks
I’m traditionally about 26 miles long

clue: I capture color on a stretched frame, a scene or face that earns my name. What am I?

hints.text: I often hang on walls to be seen
I’m made using brushes, paint, or tools
Artists create me to show scenes, people, or imagination

clue: I hang around your neck to shine and gleam, a pretty piece that adds a dream. What am I?

hints.text: I’m a piece of jewelry
I often hang from a chain around the neck
People wear me for special events or to look fancy

clue: I’m a game of kicks with goals in sight, played on fields from day to night. What am I?

hints.text: I’m played with a ball and goals
Players kick and pass the ball to score
Teams try to get the ball into the net to win

clue: I wear a red nose and antlers too, I pull a sleigh where the cold winds blew. What am I?

hints.text: I’m an animal linked to winter tales
I have antlers and often live in cold places
Santa’s sleigh is pulled by a team of us

clue: I hide your plates and cups behind my door, a tidy place on the kitchen floor. What am I?

hints.text: I have shelves behind a door
You store dishes, food, or cups in me
I’m a kitchen cabinet used to keep things neat

clue: I cut and snip with two sharp blades, used for crafting or tidy trades. What am I?

hints.text: I have two handles to hold
You press my handles together to cut paper
I’m a common classroom and craft tool for cutting

clue: I flutter small with dotted wings, a tiny friend that summer brings. What am I?

hints.text: I’m a small insect often seen on plants
I usually have bright spots on my back
Some call me a ladybug — I help eat harmful pests

clue: I grow below the ground in purple or red, a root that adds color to every spread. What am I?

hints.text: I’m a vegetable that grows underground
I’m often dark red or purple in color
You can roast or boil me and add me to salads

clue: I’m sweet and round with a hole in the middle, a tasty treat for mornings or a snack in the middle. What am I?

hints.text: I’m often glazed or sprinkled
You might eat me at breakfast with coffee or milk
I’m a ring-shaped fried or baked sweet treat
